Name: Big Break
Description:
From the back of the box:
"Now you too can play the snooker star's favourite red hot TV quiz game anytime.  Answer a question right and it's your turn to do some serious "potting".  Answer it wrongly and you're snookered.  Simply throw the dice and remember big throws could mean Big Breaks!"
Based on a hit early 90's BBC1 TV show in the UK hosted by Jim Davison and the snooker legend John Virgo.

Name: The Backbone
Description:
As described in the box:
"Just only for intelligent people"

This a game for two players. The player who gets six of his chips each of then in each of the six squares of the same color on the wooden gameboard, divided into six zones of different colors and tones forming a polygon, wins.

The game includes 20 wooden chips, 10 for each player.

A rare abstract game designed by Nike and Cooper (NAC). A 'rara avis' considering that NAC developed wargames mainly

Name: Maze Course
Description:
The players build a maze as their characters move through it, seeking to get to the final checkpoint and then back to the starting block. The characters pick up equipment, trigger explosive traps, and fight monsters and other characters.

Points are awarded for being the first player to reach each checkpoint and return to the player's starting block. Points are also scored for destroying creatures and other players. The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game.

Name: Bop Bop 'n Rebop
Description:
Box Description: Fast and furious fun for 2 to 4 players. Ages 5 thru adult. Knock it and sock it! While you try to block it! Don't let the puck scoot through! Players drop a puck onto a spinning turntable and try to protect their goals.  Don't let the puck scoot through - because if you do, you lose a point.  Three points and you lose the game.

General Description: Consists of a central turntable that spins when the game is turned on (battery powered); on this is placed one of the game's two plastic disks (large and small).   Players operate one of four plastic sliders that they may use to block the opening on their quarter of the circumference by sliding it back and forth, much like a hockey goalie.  As the turntable spins, the disk will bounce about the edges. Each player must prevent the disk from escaping through their opening by operating their slider.  Points are acquired for failing to block the disk from escaping, leading to player elimination.  Two plastic barriers are included to block player spaces that are either not being used or have been eliminated.

Name: So You Think You Know Hockey?
Description:
Description from box:

Test your hockey trivia knowledge with this action-packed, interactive board game for two or more players. Featuring 3150 challenging hockey trivia questions in seven exciting categories, plus a junior category for hockey fans of all ages!

Name: Race Across America
Description:
Race Across America is a free download game from Gen1400 Gaming.  You can download Race Across America from www.gen1400.com.

In Race Across America (RAA) you compete with other players racing across states.  Pick and choose which states you would like to race in or draw some randomly.

RAA is not just a racing game.  Before you go on to the next state you will have to complete a challenge.  The Challenge could be as easy as rolling an even number or as hard as rolling a 5.

RAA is a fun family game that is also educational.  Each state is represented by a card.  The State's capital is also listed on every state card.

Name: Journey to the Unknown
Description:
Based on the ABC television program. 2 to 4 players enter a maze and attempt to travel to their three secret rooms safely and return to start before the other players can complete their journey (to the unknown).

Microbadges based on board design:
 I find the exit to every maze
 Maze fan
 Maze fan

Name: Dictators
Description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Each player takes the role of 1 or more successive 20th century Dictators."

The game uses a custom deck composed of five types of cards: Challenge cards, Military Power cards, Political Power cards, Atrocity cards, and Wealth cards. Players score Victory Points for playing Political Power, Atrocity, and Wealth Cards.

"The game ends when a turn starts and there are no cards left in the deck. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins."

Name: Broadsword Adventures:  Savage Tales of Fantasy
Description:
Imagine yourself as a mighty-thewed barbarian, raised in the hill country of Njorden or a loyal Captain of the Lion Guard of Ibyssia, or even a powerful sorcerer in the service of Mök. Broadsword Adventures transports you to the land of Tauren where ancient secrets lie buried in lost cities, powerful necromancers seek to enslave the kingdoms of men, and around every turn there is a chance become a hero of legend or suffer ignoble defeat.

Broadsword Adventures contains all the rules necessary to play the game as well as more than two dozen archetypes to build characters, a section on designing your own scenarios, a campaign system so your characters can advance as they adventure, and five complete scenarios so that you can start playing right away.

The archetypes presented are detailed enough to make them different from one another, but generic enough that you can use these rules to fit any world you want to game in; from your own custom-designed lands to an already established setting.

Whether you want to play this as a miniatures game, a board game, or a light roleplaying game, the mechanics are easy enough and flexible enough to suit your needs.

So sharpen your blade and don your armor as you prepare for Broadsword Adventures!

124 Pages

Name: ASL Annual '97
Description:
Nhpum Ga is a historical module for Advanced Squad Leader that appeared in ASL Annual 97.

Nhpum Ga (pronounced "N Pum ga") is the name of a remote mountain village in Burma. In March 1944, the American 5037th Composite Unit (Provisional), part of the famous "Merrill's Mauraders", attempted to block the advance of Japanese units, who were threatening the flank of the Chinese 22nd division. In the course of the battle from March 28 to April 9, the American unit was completely surrounded by Japanese forces in the small 6 hut village (called "Maggot Hill" by the Americans). The vicious fighting under horrendous conditions ultimately produced nearly 400 casualties for each side. However, the Japanese advance was halted.

Contents include a full color 16.5" x 20.5" Nhpum Ga mapsheet, 4 scenarios (A115, A116, A117, A118) and a 3 page background article. All of these were part of the ASL Annual 97 issue.

Name: Versichern
Description:
A Game about insuring for the whole family.

Get your policies so you are protected by going your way all over the plan.

Name: Liebes-Spiel
Description:
A Trivia-Game about Partnership, Fun, Tears and Happiness.
Join together with any other player to move faster to the Final Question. By using characters from your horoscope you have to know your partners very good.

Name: Adventurer: Card Game – Portals Expansion
Description:
From the publisher's website:

"The Portals Expansion adds a ton of new features that all the fans have been asking for in regards to player interaction. With Portals players can now trade, do battle, and even hire thieves to steal from one another.

Portals also introduces Mystical Forces to the game, magical energies that can be a boon or a bane to all players.

- Trade and do battle with your opponents 
- Hire thieves to pilfer treasure 
- Take advantage of magical random effect cards 
- Escape deadly new traps 
- Acquire powerful treasures -- the Scroll of Life Stealing and the Divine Statue await! 
- Portals also includes 1 new hero -- designed by a player like you!"

Name: Adventurer: Card Game – Chaos Expansion
Description:
From publisher's website:

The Chaos Expansion is all about giving the players more control over their adventurers. With these new cards the player can now choose to encounter a danger, or not. Do they want attempt to open a possibly trapped chest? Failure might mean death, but success could bring a ton of treasure.

The Chaos Expansion also introduces a new way to win the game. Now instead of just being able to defeat the vampire lord to win the game, players can collect Chests of Power. The first player to collect three wins.

- Choose what your hero encounters and whether the risk is worth the reward! 
- Change the way you win the game 
- Hire henchmen to create strategic options 
- Explore new magical obstacles, traps, and random event cards 
- Discover powerful treasures 
- Chaos also includes 1 new hero -- Made by Robert Doyel!"

Name: Cubiformas
Description:
The objective of the game is to build a build a big cube (3x3)using little ones (1x1). The first player who finishes the cube wins.
The small cubes are in two colours, black and white, so you can't have a small cube next to another one of the same colour.
Once the player placed some small cubes to build the big one ha can not remove them.

El juego consiste en que cada jugador debe montar un cubo grande (3x3) a base de cubitos (1x1). El primero que lo consiga gana el juego.
Los cubitos son de dos colores, negro y blanco, no se pueden usar dos cubitos del mismo color juntos en el cubo grande.
Una vez se han colocado cubitos en el cubo grande no se pueden mover ni quitar.

Name: Freaky Forest: The Halloween Game
Description:
From the Black & White Games website:

Perfect for Halloween parties, it’s a spooky trip in the dark woods for 3 to 6 players.

After an evening of trick-or-treating you all take a shortcut through the scary woods by your homes.  In a fright you lose your candy.  Will you venture far back into the forest and retrieve lots of candy or will you get scared and lose it again?  Each turn you’ll have to decide how far to go.  In the end the one with the most candy wins!

It's a B&W Game in color!  Freaky Forest is this year’s push-your-luck game with a holiday theme.  The rules are very simple and as long as an adult or older player is in the group, children as young as five years old will be able to join in the fun with no trouble at all.

The box contains:

11 cards 
2 dice 
60 plastic chips 
Rules

It takes about 15 minutes to play.  Rules are included for fun variations including playing for candy and how to use the game to give out gifts at a party.

Name: The Future Art of War
Description:
The Future Art of War is a science fiction wargame, self-published by Leonard J. Meloche.

The game map consists of 26 planets (one starting with each letter of the alphabet).

Players start with one planet, and a small force of ships.  They occupy/conquer planets, collect and trade resources, build ships, supply their planets and attempt to discover Battleship technology.

Players are eliminated when their home planet is conquered, and victory is achieved through the elimination of all other players.

The Future Art of War includes a creative movement mechanic which adds to the "fog of war" effect.  Ships travel from planet to planet via "hyperspace", and a chart indicates the number of turns (1-6) required to travel between each pair of planets. When a ship departs for a planet, the controlling player secretly writes the first letter of the planet and the number of turns required on the bottom of the ship counter, and places it on the first space in the hyperspace track.  Each turn, all ships in the hyperspace track move one space further down the track, and, when a ship has reached the appropriate space, the controlling player reveals the ship's destination.  Therefore, while players know how many ships their opponents have in hyperspace, they do not know the ships' destinations, or when they will arrive.

The components of this game are quite good for a self-published game.  The map is poster-quality, and the cards, reference sheets, and money are comparable to many commercially published games.  The one component that clearly identifies the game as "self-published" is the ship counters, which are cut rectangles of flat plastic.  These, however, with a whiteboard marker, serve the "hyperspace" mechanic very well.  The game is packed in a large tube.

Name: Motorcade
Description:
"Card Game for 2 players. One player is an armored caravan transporting a VIP. The other player is a group of Terrorists attacking the Motorcade."

Each player uses a unique deck of cards. A set of Travel Tokens is used to track the distance between the motorcade and the terrorists.

"Victory: The Terrorists win if the VIP (The Package) is killed. The Motorcade wins if it accumulates 20+ Travel Tokens."

Name: Star Wars: Galaktische Schlachten
Description:
The game is played in rounds. In each round, a planet is picked. Players then try to conquer that planet by deploying the largest amount of troops. A conquered planet earns victory points. When Coruscant, the galaxies capital planet, is conquered, the game ends and the player with the highest victory point total wins.

Troops are represented by cards; each card has one of six colors and a number from 1 to 5 on it. A set of cards of the same color can be deployed as the force trying to conquer a planet. The total sum of the numbers printed on these cards is the troop's strength. The strongest army wins the planet, earning 2 to 4 victory points for the player who deployed that army.

Since the game is based on 2008's "Clone Wars" animated TV series, some characters from the series are featured as "generals". For each color, there is a Jedi/Sith leader or general that can be earned during the game and then played to add a +3 troop bonus. Available leaders are Commander Cody, Yoda, General Grievous, Anakin Skywalker, Asaj Ventress and Obi-Wan Kenobi.

At the end of each round, players rally new troops from the card deck to conquer the next planet.

The gameplay is rather quick and simple, strategic options are limited, and some luck is involved in getting matching colored cards from the card deck.

There is an alternate name for this game: "Sith gegen Jedi" (Sith vs. Jedi).

Name: Deutschland-Rallye
Description:
The object is to move from city to city throughout Germany, answering questions about the specific cities, and collecting chips for correct answers.

There is a 6-sided die for determining the question area and two 12-sided dice for determining which city is the target.

The rulebook includes all the pertinent information for each city.

Name: Starfighter Combat
Description:
Starfighter Combat is a mass combat game.
 A game of tactics and intuition, players strive to out-maneuver and out think their opponents in Star fighter
combat. The players may control single Star fighters or entire squadrons. The rules are flexible enough for multi-player combat and more detailed scenarios.

In this game each Star fighter has attributes:  
Max Speed, Speed, Impetus, Armor and Shields.

You use cards to control your ships movement.

The game includes ship building rules, and many different ships already made. 


Free from:
http://www.geocities.com/shaungamer88/sfc.htm

Name: Das 80er Jahre Quiz
Description:
You remember Walkman, E.T., Nena, Maggie Thatcher or the musical Cats? 
Then you are the right one for this Quiz.
Over 4.400 Questions and Answers waiting to transport you to the final Question.
Be a 80s expert!!!

Name: Auf dem Weg zum Millionär: Die 80er Jahre
Description:
Traveling Game with more than 1.000 Questions concerning the 80s.
MUSIC-LIFESTYLE-HAPPENINGS-TV and CINEMA-SPORTS-CULTURE

Name: Friendly Fire Pack 1
Description:
Friendly Fire Pack 1 contains eight small to medium-sized scenarios. Most of them are designed for the Friendly Fire ASL Tournament held in Linköping, Sweden.

Scenarios included:

     FrF1 - Jarama Proving Ground
     FrF2 - Maczek Fire Brigade
     FrF3 - The Swedish Voluntary Corps
     FrF4 - Barbarossa D-day
     FrF5 - The Valley of Death
     FrF6 - A Hundred Rounds
     FrF7 - To Have and To Hold
     FrF8 - Second Thoughts

Name: Friendly Fire Pack 2
Description:
Friendly Fire Pack 2 contains eight scenarios featured in the Friendly Fire 2006 ASL tournament held in Linköping, Sweden. Despite being tournament scenarios, they vary in size between small and large.

Scenarios included:

     FrF9 - The Abbeville Bridgehead
     FrF10 - Assault on Wielki Dzial
     FrF11 - Rostov Redemption
     FrF12 - The Fields of Black Gold
     FrF13 - Knives to a Gunfight
     FrF14 - Patton Breaks Loose
     FrF15 - Kampfgruppe 1001 Nacht
     FrF16 - Last Orders

Name: Friendly Fire Pack 3
Description:
Friendly Fire Pack 3 contains eight scenarios featured in the Friendly Fire 2007 ASL tournament held in Linköping, Sweden.

Scenarios included:

     FrF17 - The Marco Polo Bridge Incident
     FrF18 - Through Fire and Ice
     FrF19 - About His Shadowy Sides
     FrF20 - Adolf's Amateurs
     FrF21 - Cavalry Brigade Model
     FrF22 - Wunderwaffe
     FrF23 - Elephants Unleashed
     FrF24 - Forging Spetsnaz

Name: GOES/POES Wild World of Weather Adventure Game
Description:
Be the first the pilot your weather airship from San Francisco, CA all the way around the world and back across the USA to Miami, while earning at least 35 Adventure Chips.

You need the game board which you will move around, and you also have 3 different sets of question cards (easy, medium, and hard) which you will answer to gain Adventure Chips.

This is a roll and move game with some education questions thrown.

Get the game free from:
http://spaceplace.nasa.gov/en/educators/posters/#wwa

Name: ASL Annual '93b
Description:
One of the Avalon Hill magazines presenting articles and scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader. This one included a center insert for a 'mini-HASL': Gavutu-Tanambogo


From the Table of Contents:

Sand & Blood by Dan Dolan
First to Fight! by Steven Swann
Annual Crossfire: Holding the Rear by Robert Banozic & Mark Nixon
Warriors of the North by Michael Dorosh
First on the Beach by Bleck, Burnett & Martin
Notes to the Troops by Rex A. Martin
Tiger Trap by Rex A. Martin

Contents also included three island map overlays for Gavutu, Tanambogo and Gaomi to be placed on top of Ocean overlays, 6 page background article, the "Sand & Blood" GT campaign game, 3 regular scenarios (HASL A3, A4, A5), Japanese setup play aid sheet, 2 page After Action Report. These components are due to be reprinted in the new Rising Sun PTO module.

The first phase of American move into the Solomon islands and Guadalcanal in 1942 called for an attack on Tulagi, an island with a good anchorage and the site of a Japanese seaplane base. Gavutu, Tanambogo and Gaomi are tiny islands off the coast of Tulagi. Between Gavutu and Tanambogo was 300 yard causeway constructed out of concrete and coral. These islands were to be taken in a small part of the main operation against Tulagi. Faulty intelligence had estimated that there were only a "few dozen" construction troops and snipers on these islands. The reality was more like 350 troops including SNLF dug into fortifications and caves. The defenders held out for 31 hours of bitter fighting against an amphibious invasion by the US Marines including suicide charges across a cricket field.

Scenarios:
A61 Across the Wire
A62 Paole Zion
A63 Action at Balberkamp
A64 Chateau de Quesnoy
A65 The Dinant Bridgehead
A66 Counterstroke at Stonne
A67 Monte Castello
DA12 Tussle at Thomashof
HA3 Grabbing Gavutu
HA4 Tanambogo Nightmare
HA5 Take Two

Name: Wissensspektrum II
Description: Who knows the answers to 7.200 questions? Nice Party-Game for players who love to answer very hard questions.

Name: Hell Over Korea
Description:
"HELL OVER KOREA" is an expansion module for "B-29 SUPERFORTRESS"  and covers B-29 missions in the Korean War from November 1950 through April 1951, covering a standard six-month bomber crew tour of duty in Korea.  NOTE THAT YOU MUST OWN A COPY OF "B-29 SUPERFORTRESS" TO PLAY "HELL OVER KOREA."

The time period covered in the Variant was chosen because it was the most dynamic period of the war for the B-29. Early missions (i.e., before November 1950) for the bomber met with little enemy opposition, with (relatively ineffective) raids against tactical targets.  North Korea’s few strategic targets and industries were also quickly disposed of.  In November 1950, however, the Chinese Communists were in the war, and the B-29 began facing its first serious opposition with the introduction of large numbers of Soviet MiG-15 jet fighters.  It was now a real contest.

Name: Rome at War: King of Kings
Description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Rome at War: King of Kings

From the Euphrates to the Indus, the writ of the King of Kings stood supreme in the Sassanid Persian Empire. Enforcing this power was the Sassanid army, with its herds of war elephants and its awesome armored cavalry. For four hundred years the Sassanids battled first the Romans and then the Byzantines, until Arab armies fueled by the passion of Islam swept over both old foes.

King of Kings is a new book supplement for the Series: Rome at War (Avalanche Press) family, using the same format as the many books we've published for the Series: Panzer Grenadier (Avalanche) or Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press). It is not playable by itself; pieces and maps from Rome at War II: Fading Legions are required to enjoy all of its scenarios.

But there are also new armies: Palmyra and Parthia fight both Persian and Roman enemies, and there are new units and leaders for Persia and Rome as well. All told there are 88 double-sized and 88 more merely large playing pieces (that's a full sheet and half of another); all of them scorchless, sootless laser-cut little works of art on our new tile-like material. There are also background articles and over a dozen new scenarios.

Name: Assault at Cold Harbor
Description:
Solitaire tactical American Civil War game re-creating the battle of Cold Harbor near Richmond, VA from May 31-June 12, 1864.

Reprinted in a separate (ziplock) printing from its original appearance in Panzerschreck #3 (1999) as "Cold Harbor II" with map, counters and rules that "are slightly modified from the original edition". Reprinted again in 2015 in Panzer Digest #12 as "Assault at Cold Harbor" with color map and counters and updated rules.

Description: The player (Union) makes a frontal assault against entrenched Confederate positions in the hope of achieving a breakthrough.

Name: Clear for Action
Description:
World War II Micronaval Miniature Gaming. Uses 1:1200 or 1:2400 scale ship miniatures. 
Game Designer: Spencer Martin
Ship Data Charts: John Hugener

Game uses charts for ship classes and detailed damage locations.

Players write orders for movement on paper records as well as for firing guns on targets and estimate ranges (guestimation).

After all players have written orders, orders are carried out by moving the ships as indicated on the orders. Torpedo launches are resolved and gunfire is resolved.

Name: Tumbili
Description:
A fun family game. Goal: To be the first to reach the top of the tree with three peanuts.

You will need to guard against predators! And earn peanuts by getting to the end of the branches or by collecting families of monkeys.

Un jeu très rigolo pour jouer en famille. Pour gagner, il faut arriver le premier en haut de l’arbre avec trois cacahuètes. 
Gare aux prédateurs. 
On attrape ces fameuses cacahuètes soit au bout des branches ou en reconstituant des familles de singes. 
Mais gare aux prédateurs et vive les régimes de bananes et les noix de coco.

Name: Our Town
Description: OUR TOWN by M. Flint Productions, Grand Central Station, New York, NY.  The object of OUR TOWN is to be the first player to complete all five Apple Adventures. This is done by first completing all four red apple adventures (Sites & events, Broadway, Fiscal Crisis, and Central Park) and thus qualifing for entrance into the Golden Apple. Completion of the Golden Apple adventure wins the game.

Name: Rapa-nui
Description:
After a trip to Isla de Pascua (Easter Island), the author brings to us this game based on the inhabitants of the island and the extinction of them.

The Rapa-Nui tribes were isolated about 1000 years in a remote, tiny and volcanic island. There were a lack of resources and the population lived in a unstable balance with the environment, the rivalry between tribes and the collective society.

THE GAME

Players manage the building of the 'moais' (these big sculptures with big faces, facing to the sea), using quarries, men, palm trees (to take wood) and even 'slaves'.

I had heard from some testers that the mechanics of the game were very similar to Puerto Rico, but the only similarity is the 'role selection' phase.

The game is only available (rules and components) for Print & Play at: http://kokorin.wordpress.com/2008/06/15/rapa-nui/

Name: Wizards of Soccer
Description:
Complete MagicSoccer Card Game
Created and illustrated by Alessandro Dolcetta

It is a complete deck of cards composed of
36 Offensive Cards
36 defensive Cards
8 Team cards
5 Ball Cards
2 Yellow Cards
4 Red Cards
1 Rule sheet

The game is a funny simulation of a Soccer match, played by Wizards, that with their Spells Cards try to advance the ball onto the opposite net to score a Goal. 
First who score two Goals wins or you can play by time.

It is an easy game where offensive and defensive player, play simultaneously their Card. Depending on the position on the field (formed by 16 cards)you match different combos that may be a dribbling, a shoot, an interception, a corner or... a goal!

Cards are easy to read: they just report the name of the offensive or defensive spells (in Latin) and the number power of that spell.
The different colours of the cards background greatly help to recognize each of them when you have your hand of 11 cards.

Very good for children, for the coloured "comics" illustrations, and families that wish to relax with a simple, easy game.

On the Author website
www.alex-games.com
find plenty of info also in english, pictures and descriptions.

Wizards of Soccer will be present at 
Angelo Porazzi Games Booth 9-30 Essen 2008
with English rulesheet

Name: La soupe à Gertrude
Description:
La Soupe Ã  Gertrude (Gertrude's soup) is a game where each players are trying to obtain enough ingredients to make their soup first. There are 5 types of ingredients in the deck of cards, you only need 3 differents.

The current player pick the 3 top cards of the deck, choose one that will be face up, the others face down. Now (in no specific order), all the players bid on the lot. Once the winning bid has been found, that player will pay the other players by giving them cards for the total bidded, then pick up the lot. If he has 3 different ingredients, he wins.

Name: Black Path Game
Description:
This elegant little game is playable on a rectangular grid with square Trax-like tiles, each of which has 2 black lines connecting pairs of sides (either opposite pairs of sides, or adjacent pairs of sides).  Players alternate placing tiles, each tile extending the black path from a designated start arrow at the side of the board.  If a player connects the path to the edge of the board, they lose.

The game is analyzed and solved in the combinatorial game theory book Winning Ways for Your Mathematical Plays (pages 746-747, volume 3 of A K Peters 2003 edition).  The first player can win if the grid has an even number squares, and the second player can win if the grid has an odd number of squares.

Name: La Course à la Vanille
Description:
The aim of the game is to collect 10 cocoa, 10 tea and 10 vanilla tokens.
Players move using a die into several production areas in order to collect tokens and deliver them.
If there is a green spot on a production area, player must take an event card.
Components:
A board, 6 players token, 6 delivery cards, 180 goods token, 1 vanilla perfume bottle.

Name: The gift increase of Haruhi Suzumiya
Description:
Japanese home-brew

Translated from the box back:
"I'm telling you, we're here for the win! I won't allow one single loss! I HATE to lose!"
In this game, players take the roles of characters in "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya", and tries to fulfill his/her victory conditions all the while trying to figure out who plays who. Let Haruhi win, conceal your identity, see through your opponents' plans and live out the events in the SOS group.

Name: Feelina
Description:
The magical search for the butterflies …

There is trouble in fairy land. Just as they were getting ready for the annual fairy ball, an evil wizard placed a spell on all the fairies. Suddenly they can’t find their way to the castle, and the fairy ball is in danger. Fortunately, there are the butterflies – they know the way. But all the butterflies are sleeping, hidden beneath colourful leaves. Will you help Feelina and her fairy friends find the butterflies? Here’s a tip: Each butterfly has its own colourful pattern! Can you see the differences? The wheel of fortune will tell you which butterfly you need to find. Isn’t there a tiny piece of a wing peeking out? Now hurry – surely you want to be the first to reach the castle.

contents:
4 fairy figures, 15 butterflies, 15 leaves, 1 dial, 4 castle cards, instructions

Name: Picco Klecksolino
Description:
Oh dear, Mr. Klecks the artist has stumbled and all of his colors have fallen onto the floor. Who can help him sort the colors correctly onto his palette? The person to find all the colors and then shout out “Klecksolino!” is the winner.

Oh dear, Mr. Klecks the artist has stumbled and all of his paints have fallen onto the floor. Who can help him sort the colored paints correctly onto the palettes? It’s not really all that difficult: first the lighter colors, yellow and orange, then red and of course, blue and green – look carefully at your palette. Now you’ve just got to find the right colors, which are lying around all mixed up, and you are only allowed to turn over one colored tile at a time. Can you remember which tile lies where? Watch very carefully which colors the other players have turned over and then you should be alright. Have you found all of the colors and sorted them correctly onto the palette? Quickly shout out “Klecksolino” and then you’ve won.

Name: The League: the Football Card Game
Description:
"Some people believe football is a matter of life and death.  I'm very disappointed with that attitude.  I can assure them, it is much, much more important than that."  -  Bill Shankly

In The League players take turns playing cards to attempt to build up an attack culminating in a shot on the opponent's goal or to foil that attack with a well placed tackle or save.  The two-player game pits the players head to head where the 4-player game has two players per team working as a partnership.  Each player starts with 7 cards, replacing cards played with cards from the deck and the game comes to an end after one run through the deck.

The cards are divided into attacking cards eg. Pass, Dribble, Shoot, defending cards eg. Tackle, Save, referee cards, eg. Offside, Penalty, and wonder cards, eg. Wonder Goal, Wonder Save.  The side with possession aims to build up a series of attacking cards leading to a shot thundering past the opponent's keeper, the defending side tries to get possession with a tackle or to get the keeper on the end of the shot with a save card.  Tackles have the risk of being countered by a referee dishing out a yellow or a red card or even a penalty which can only be saved by a Wonder Save.

The game plays in under half an hour and makes for a good filler especially with football fans.

Name: The Berenstain Bears Giant Card Game
Description:
From the back of the box:

"The object of play is to collect the four members of the Berenstain Bear family (Mama, Papa, Brother and Sister Bear) and their matching hats.

The begin play, shuffle the cards and place them face-down in the center of the table. The top card is turned face-up and placed in a separate discard pile. Decide who will play first. The first player selects the top card from either the draw or discard pile. If the selected card is a Berenstain Bear, the player takes the card and places it in front of him. If the card is a hat or WIND card, the player places it on the discard pile. Play passes to the left with the next player selecting a card from either the draw or discard pile.

As players collect members of the Berenstain Bear family, the may "cap" each character with the appropriate hat. For example, on his first turn a player draws a Brother Bear card. On a later turn he draws Brother Bear's baseball hat. He may then "cap" Brother Bear by placing the hat card on the Brother Bear card. If a player draws a hat but does not have the character that matches it, OR if the character already has his/her hat, the card must be discarded. Note that some cards feature two hats. Players may choose which hat, if any, to use and "cap" the appropriate bear. Once a character is "capped", the hat may not be removed unless it is blown off by a WIND card (see below).

If a player draws a WIND card, he may blow one hat off any of his opponents' cards. The hat and WIND cards are then placed on the discard pile. A player may not remove a WIND card from the discard pile.

The first player to match all four Berenstain Bear characters with their correct hats wins the game.

Name: DOMES
Description:
DOMES is a free downloadable game from Gen1400 Gaming.  You can download DOMES from the website www.gen1400.com.

You control a group of Domians trying to survive constant alien attacks.  Each Domian can perform one action per turn.  You decide whether to gather food, fuel, materials, or to repair your DOME.  After the action phase the aliens will fire their lasers trying to destroy your DOME and all of your Domians.

Can you survive 15 turns?

Name: DOMES 2: The Domians Fight Back
Description:
This is the second game in the DOMES serious.  In DOMES 2: The Domians Fight Back, the Domians have returned to out live the alien invaders.  This time they come armed with the ability to build a laser to defeat the aliens.

DOMES 2 is played just like DOMES only this time you work on building and then firing your laser to destroy the aliens.  Whoever destroys the alien spaceship wins the game.

DOMES 2 is a free downloadable game from Gen1400 Gaming.  Visit www.gen1400.com to download your free copy today.

Name: Piet Piraat: Schattenjacht
Description: Goal of the game is to get as quickly as possible to the treasure. In order to get there you have to collect some items. Without these items you cannot get past the obstacles.

Name: League of Six: Loyal Retinue
Description:
This expansion includes components for a 6th player.  It also introduces the ability to gather a retinue of supporters.  When visiting towns, the players get supporters from various social classes.  These loyals help players during the game or the final scoring.

Expands:

    League of Six

Name: Trackgammon
Description:
From the box:
"A table game for 4 players.
Contents 740mm x 340mm gaming cloth, 48 pieces, 2 dice and shaker, rules.
A new variation on Backgammon which is twice as much fun and more sociable as up to 4 can play,"
The aim of the game is to bring all 12 of your pieces onto your home track and then bear them off the board, the first to do this wins.

Name: Todos contra el fuego
Description:
This game simulates how could be a forest fire, and the objective for the player (can be played by more than 1 player but all play together) is to control it using strategy. Depending on how you placed all the pieces before the fire started you will do a better job.
The game ends when the fire is over or when the players are thrown away from the board by the fire. The fire is not controlled by any player, it grows and moves automatically depending on the wind and other factors.
This game was created to teach students in schools how is a forest fire, and how people work to prevent and control fires.

Name: It Fits
Description:
From the back of the box:

ANYONE can come up with something that FITS. But, can you come up with something that fits the criteria of the most cards, and that EVERYONE can agree upon? Can you convince them? Can you talk them into it? It Fits is the hilariously fun game ideal for families and friends. It's laugh-out-loud fun!

It's this easy...
1. Each player is given a card and six cards are placed face-up on the game board.
2. Think of something that 'fits' the criteria of the card in your hand and as many of the face-up cards as possible.
3. When time's up, each player reveals their answer and makes their case as to why "It Fits" each card.
4. If everyone agrees, move forward. If they disagree, move back. First player to the end of the game board wins!

Name: Kron, el bosque maldito
Description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside, with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

"Kron, el bosque maldito" ("Kron, the Cursed Forest") appeared in issue 4 and was kind of a fantasy wargame where up to 6 players gathered warriors and wizards groups that fought evil creatures while searching for treasures.

Name: La guerra Irán-Irak
Description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside, with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

Issue 3 included "La guerra Irán-Irak", an easy to learn  wargame (two page rules) for two players about the conflict between these two Arabian countries which lasted from 1980 to 1988.

This game was originally published first inside issue 4 of NUMERO UNO magazine in 1980

Name: Arithmechips Multiplication Game
Description:
Arithmechips Multiplication Game

(c)2004 Creative Toys Ltd.

"Plan the pathway to jump over the most chips, solve the multiplication exercises, and win the game!"

This educational math game teaches students Ages 7 and up   about multiplication. Players solve math problems and "jump" score chips as in a game of checkers.

Includes a colorful puzzle-cut game board, 208 sturdy chips, practice pages, scoreboard, plastic storage tray, and instructions.

Designed for 2 to 4 players.

Name: Armageddon
Description:
Armageddon is a simple multi-player wargame played on a map of the world. Each player has an identical force of land, sea, and air War Machines with which he or she tries to destroy the opposing forces. There are decks of Satellite and Anti-Satellite cards which may provide the appropriate orbital War Machines: satellites can destroy units in 4x4 sections of the board and anti-satellites can destroy satellites.

From the box cover: "... in the future, non-violent electronic wars will be fought on land, at sea, in the air and outer space on simulated battlefields by unmanned war machines ..." "... there will be six superpowers involved in a total struggle for non-violent economic dominance of the planet earth: strategic skills bring victory, not death ..."

Components:

     Board
     Rules
     Die
     12 satellite cards (6 good, 6 blank)
     12 anti-satellite cards (same)
     6 sets of counters, each containing 7 sea units, 7 land units, 6 air units, and 4 satellites

Name: El juego del mono de oro
Description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside, with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

"El juego del mono de oro" was the game included in issue 6. It was based in the pseudo-Indiana Jones 80s TV series "Tales of the Gold Monkey", set in the pre-II World War Japanese dominated Pacific Ocean´s isles . Up to 4 players could play, each one starting with and adventurer and a seaplane counters and searching for mythical treasures while eluding or confronting fighters and gunboats.

Name: Jaw Breaker
Description:
Jaw Breaker is a rather simple roll and move game with an interesting twist. A major component of the game is the large plastic shark into the mouth of which 4" balloons are inserted.

A plastic game mat lays out a path from the site of a shipwreck across several islands to the shore. The objective is to move your castaway towards the shore by the roll of the die.

On the board are both red and white spaces. Each time the marker stops on a red space, the player is required to rotate the dorsal fin of the shark. As the shark's mouth closes, pressure is put on the balloon, eventually causing it to burst (two small pins inside the shark's mouth insure eventual destruction of the balloon). How much pressure is required is primarily dependent on the inflation level of the balloon.

If the player causes the balloon to burst, he or she returns their castaway to the starting position and the shark is reset with a new balloon. The winner is the first player to successfully reach the shore.

Name: Mississippi Run
Description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Theme: Commerce on the Mississippi River Basin using Riverboats in the early 19th Century."

The game uses a custom deck composed of four types of cards: Cargo, Tributary, Boat, and Event Cards. The players score points by playing melds of Boat, Tributary, and Cargo Cards. The number of points scored for playing a meld varies from 1 to 7, based on the number of Cargo Cards the meld contains.

The first player to reach twenty-five points wins the game.

Name: Primary Pups
Description:
From the Publisher:
      
PRIMARY PUPS--The HOME GAME incorporates the 1st-3rd grade curriculum.  All players answer all questions; 300 multiple choice informational cards in 6 subjects--math, science, grammar, history, geography and health.

Name: GuldGraver
Description:
In GuldGraver ("Gold Digger") players try to find gold. The first to dig gold worth of $500 wins the game.

The game board is divided in two areas: the village and the woods. In the village you have to make some money first to buy a shovel and a pick axe and optionally buy or rent a horse to travel faster. Then you can go and look for gold from the woods.

During the game players face (though action cards) various incidents; some good, some bad. You may for example lose all your money to Indians, find lost gold, get into a saloon fight or win in the casino. Players pull action cards to determine what happens.

Name: Roadkill
Description:
From the Publisher:

"Most hunters use stealth, sharp instincts and a loaded rifle to claim their prize.

Not You.

You prefer the loud thundering of diesel engines.

You live for that look on your prey's face as it glances up and sees nothing but headlights and bumper.

You aren't the only one either.

It's the National Roadkill Championships and the best are here to test their wits and cars against one another.

Happy Hunting."

Also requires d4, d6, d8 and d10 to play.

Name: Munchkin Quest 2: Looking for Trouble
Description:
From the publisher:

Trouble means gold. Trouble means leveling up. And with Munchkin Quest 2 – Looking for Trouble, you can find trouble with up to six players. More help against the monsters! More friends to backstab! More competition for the loot! Whoops, forget we said that last bit.

And now the dungeon has Traps. Axes and arrows, flames and falling rocks . . . Maybe you can dodge. Maybe you can push your buddy in front of you.

Explore 18 new rooms . . . the Tomb Room! The Doom Room! The Chamber of Horrors! If you survive, spend your gold at Ye Swankie Donjon Shoppe . . . or Ye Cheape Donjon Shoppe, if you're not picky. Shake off those pesky monsters in the Sun Room, and get healed at the Temple of Generic Niceness.

And new monsters! Flee the stomping power of Bigfoot! Fear the tiny terror that is the Fright Sprite! Fight the sticky menace of the Gummi Golem! Plus more weapons, scrolls, and potions to equip your character, new curses to inflict on your fellow munchkins, and a new kind of passageway that lets you grab gold between rooms.

Components:

100 Cards
12 Health Tokens
17 Gold Pieces
12 Dropped Item Tokens
10 Move Tokens
3 Search Result Tokens
2 Level Counters
2 Munchkins
6 Monster Bases
9 Room Tiles
27 Links
13 Monster Standies
4 6-Sided dice, two for each player
1 rulesheet

Expands:

    Munchkin Quest

Name: Bible Journeys Number 1: Egypt to Canaan
Description:
Bible Journeys Number 1: Egypt To Canaan

This is a religious trivia game. Players draw cards and answer questions about the Bible. If a player answers correctly that player moves foward the number of spaces shown on the card. First player to the Promised Land wins!

Includes a board, two decks of cards, 6 tokens, rules, answer book, and storage insert.

Name: Picco Contrario
Description:
A memory game another way round:
Instead of looking for a match, an opposite must be found as quickly as possible: round and square, short and long, heavy and light. Who can find the most pairs?

contents:
20 Picture cards depicting 10 opposite pairs
Instructions

Name: Acoso en Nicaragua
Description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside, with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

Issue 5 included "Acoso en Nicaragua" which, despite its name ("Pursuit in Nicaragua"), it´s not properly a wargame. The board is a squared one. Each player has a commandant and 36 soldiers (Americans and Sandinistas). Each turn, they move the commandant one square, then places a soldier counter (which can´t never move) trying to immobilize the enemy leader. It´s that simple.

Name: Probability Poker
Description:
Produced in 1966 by the TALCRAN Co. of Olympia, Washington state, USA. The components consist of a long & somewhat deep box, a bi-folding game board that is 19-inches by 19-&-3/16ths-inches, a scoring pad, a deck of regular playing cards, a pencil, the tri-folded single paper sheet of rules, and a smaller paper sheet addendum with the "Casino A" version for this.

From the instructions: 
The object of the game is to obtain the highest score in each turn by:

1. Keeping the three poker hands dealt, or
2. Improving any or all of the poker hands by drawing new cards from the supply of DRAW CARDS.

Play of Game:
A. Determination of Discards.

B. Improving the Poker Hands.

C. Scoring of Turn:
After the play of cards, the score for each turn is determined by comparing the poker hands obtained with the scoring table in the lower right hand corner of the playing board. The scoring table is reproduced in Figure *[5]

Winner of the Game:
The person having the highest number of points after ten turns is the winner of the game. These scores my be compared with those calculated for several classes of players as shown in Figure *[6]


    NB (those are denoted in the Rules as well with upon the game's board).

Name: Pantomime
Description:
This game of charades contains 972 Mime Cards with 6 charades on each card, an electronic timer, 2 reference cards with common charade gestures and a six sided die. Teams take turns rolling the die to determine which charade category will be acted out. Categories of charades include: movie, song, quote, play, book, and poem. Game length is determined by the number of rounds teams decide upon at the start of the game.

Additional information is provided on the cards to assist the acting player associate a song with the performer, a book with the author, a play with the playwright, and a poem with the poet.

Name: Valor & Vengeance
Description:
Valor & Vengeance simulates the dramatic pinnacle of General Wrangel’s offensive to seize the key city of Tsaritysn (Stalingrad in WW2).Armed British manned tanks and supported in the air with the 47th Squadron, the White forces struck along the Volga River.
Partly through deception and strategy that soaked off  the Red’s most powerful force: Budyonny’s Cavalry Corps, which had opposed the White cavalry corps’ under the esteemed Mamontov up to the 29th.  Pulling back to regroup, Budyonny’s  men continued to be held in check. When Mamontov attack simultaneously on the 29th, it effectively canceled out any chance that Budyonny would be involved in the White attack from the south. Had this not happened, Tsaritsyn would have been a bloodbath.

The map scale is about 800 yards per hex. Each combat unit is one battalion for non-AFV units. For Tanks ,Armor cars Aircraft, each counter is one AFV\AC. For weapons, each counter is four weapons. A game turn represents TWO hours of time.

The game contains:

• One 11 x 17" mapsheet depicting the terrain the battle was fought over
• 2 player aids for charts and tables. 
• One set of 280 ½" playing pieces
• A rulebook.

Name: Azules y grises
Description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside (two in issues 7 and 8), with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

One of the games included in issue 8 was "Azules y grises - La batalla de Bull Run", set in the American Civil War. It was a straightforward, 3 pages rules wargame in the usual line of the magazine.

Name: First Aid Challenge
Description:
From the Publisher:

FIRST AID CHALLENGE is a board game that promotes first aid awareness.  The game consists of one game board, 4 colored tokens, one die, 40 kit cards, and 40 event cards.  The goal of the game is for each player to move around the game board collecting kit cards.

Name: Travels
Description:
Travels is one of six pencil and paper games described in the Sid Sackson book,  Calculate! .

The playing sheet is similar to the “distances between major cities” schematic diagram found in a road atlas.  It shows roadway segments and mileage connecting 50 cities.   A mathematical operation is performed on the calculator to randomly select 10 of the cities.  Players begin at separate cities among the chosen 10, then move 1 or 2 road segments each turn while choosing a path that visits each of the remaining 9 in any order. Lowest total distance traveled for a circuit back to the starting point wins the game.

Name: ASL Action Pack #5: East Front
Description:
(from MMP website:)

ASL Action Pack #5 - East Front is a scenario bundle featuring the battles fought on the East Front. The scenarios represent actions from Barbarossa through the bitter end in 1945 with three new ASL geomorphic maps (56, 57, 58). Action Pack #5 - East Front is sure to be enjoyed by veteran ASL players.

ASL Action Pack #5 - East Front contains:

    3 ASL geomorphic mapboards (56, 57, and 58)
    12 ASL scenarios featuring the new maps


Scenarios:

    AP41 The Meat Grinder - 5 turns, 25 June, 1941, Lutsk, Russia
    AP42 Frontiers and Pioneers - 6.5 turns, 26 June, 1941, Skaudvila, Russia
    AP43 Escape from Encirclement - 6 turns, 3 August, 1941, Podvyssokoya-Peregonorka, Russia
    AP44 The Burial Mound - 7.5 turns, 16 September, 1942, Stalingrad, Russia
    AP45 Reaping Rewards - 5.5 turns, 20 December, 1942, Kruzhilin, Russia
    AP46 Red Comrades - 5.5 turns, 20 March, 1943, Taranovka, Russia
    AP47 Insult to Injury - 6.5 turns, 12 July, 1943, Storozhevoe, Russia
    AP48 Up Inferno Hill - 7.5 turns, 14 July, 1943, Werchopenje, Russia
    AP49 Retrained and Rearmed - 6.5 turns, 26 October, 1944, Banska Bystricka, Slovakia
    AP50 Panzergeist - 5.5 turns, 30 October, 1944, Olszak, Poland
    AP51 Something to Prove - 7.5 turns, 18 January, 1945, Sid, Yugoslavia
    AP52 Into Vienna Woods - 6 turns, 17 April, 1945, St. Polten, Austria



ASL modules needed:

    For King and Country
    Yanks
    West of Alamein
    Code of Bushido
    Armies of Oblivion
    Last Hurrah/Doomed Battalions
    Croix de Guerre
    AP3, Few Returned

Name: So ein Kamel
Description:
Players allocate their dice to load and unload differently numbered camels.

Game ends when all camels are loaded. Players score points for individual camels and rows and columns of camels 'they have loaded'. Player with the most vp wins!

Name: Monopoly: Dominick's Collector's Edition
Description: This edition of monopoly was sold in Dominick's Stores in the Chicago Area from 2006-2007. The board consists of spaces related to the grocery store chain and it's subsidiaries.

Name: What Would Jesus Do?
Description:
From the Box:  WWJD?  What Would Jesus Do?  The life-changing Game About Good Decisions

WWJD? is a fun-filled, fast-paced board game fo kids that the entire family will want to play.  WWJD? provides hours of exciting game-play while developing the life-changing habit of asking, "What would Jesus Do?" every time a decision needs to be made.  Laugh along with Jason and Mx as you encounter 150 comical, yet true-to-life situations built around six major Christ-like character traits: love, obedience, generosity, humility, faithfulness and truthfulness.

Stars Jason and Mx from the highly successful 101 Questions Children Ask book series.

Features a full color action gameboard with tunnels, bridges and dead ends

Includes 150 WWJD? situation cards, 60 Character Cards, six playing pieces and one die.

Designed for family fun, ages six and up.

Can be played in teams or by 2-6 individual players.

Name: Six Flags 3-D Board Game
Description:
Six Flags It's Playtime! 3-D Board Game

Youngest Player goes first.  Draw cards move the number of spaces shown.  Follow directions on spaces when they are landed.  It's a race to the finish weaving around the 3-D amusement rides.  First one to finish wins.

Name: Area 51
Description:
Everyone knows that Area 51 is for real and that aliens have infiltrated the populace of Roswell. An FBI agent, devoted to uncovering the truth, is trying to discover the identity of these aliens as townsfolk are abducted during the night and taken to the mother ship.

During the day, the Roswellians meet, discuss, make accusations, and then send someone off to Area 51 to be "examined." Yeah, these people are a suspicious bunch ... but they're right!  They know they've been invaded by aliens and Area 51 is going to help them sort things out.

Name: Operation Compass & Wavell's 30,000 (Special Edition Critical Hit Magazine)
Description:
Critical Hit's long awaited SPECIAL EDITION of CH Magazine, the Operation Compass & Wavell's 30,000 issue. How did the 'Desert Rats' of O'Connor's Western Desert Force, consisting of 7th Armoured Division (minus a brigade), a support group of two regiments of Royal Horse Artillery, and two motor battalions, do it? The story is laid before you, from the Italian invasion of Egypt to the dramatic ambush at Beda Fomm in the pages of Critical Hit Magazine's Operation Compass & Wavell's 30,000 SPECIAL EDITION. In one of the most memorable campaigns of World War II the British defeated the Italians in Egypt, Libya and Cyrenaica in the last weeks of 1940 and early 1941. The magazine includes a full historical map and 22 scenarios.

Note: the map edition of the magazine is sold out and out of print. The magazine is available with 19 scenarios.

Name: super loto
Description:
Contents : 2 set of cards : one with red figures (for drawing), one with blue figures (allowing you to attempt to realize the same arrangement that your drawing). 100 tokens numbered as follows: 20 of value 100, 40 of value 50, 40 of value 10.

Your goal is to be the first to complete the lottery arrangement of your card.

Name: Flicking Football
Description:
Flicking Football
Strike it toward the goal post!

Notwithstanding the Japanese market it is targeted at, the game simulates 'kicking' a football through an American football goal. For some reason (maybe it flicks better) the football is shaped like an isosceles right angled triangle. Players take turns trying to flick the football with their fingers through the goal posts. The stand for the goal incorporates a metal spring - hitting the posts and causing the goal to sway means a miss, even if the football does pass between the posts.
Players try to score more goals than other players.

From the instructions on the back:
"How to play - Use the finger pinball to goal. It can succeed if the ball through the goal, otherwise it will be failed if the ball bumps the post."

Name: Flip to Win Travel Bingo
Description: From the publisher "BINGO on the go! Choose an appropriate theme among the eight provided, slide a card into each game boards and pay attention to the passing scenery! Includes two game boards and four double-sided game cards. There are no loose pieces and everything stores conveniently in the board. Great for travel!"

Name: Volley & Bayonet: Road to Glory
Description:
Volley & Bayonet Road to Glory is an updated version of the Volley & Bayonet black powder miniatures rules.  As with the previous version, the emphasis is on gaming entire battles of the black powder era.  While the emphasis of this edition is the Napoleonic period, rules are given for gaming the entire black powder era (approximately 1700-1890).

Each stand represents from 1000-3000 men or 6-18 guns.  The scale is 1" = 100 yards.

Scenarios and orders of battle are included for:

The Trebbia
Marengo
Austerlitz
Auerstaedt
Eylau
Talavera
Dennewitz
Quatre Bras

The important changes from the previous edition are:

1) The Road to Glory is a system of creating realistic non-historical "pickup" games.  Players divide their starting force into multiple wings, then draw two deployment cards (include) and choose one.  Players deploy their wings in the order listed, and fight the battle to conclusion.

2.  There have been significant changes to the skirmisher rules to better reflect the realities of combat between armies with poor and better skirmishing capabilities.

3.  Linear infantry (typically pre- or early Napoleonic) has been strengthened relative to massed infantry and there are new rules for dispersed artillery (formerly called battalion guns).

Name: Super Vache Règles optionnelles, raretés et autres vacheries
Description:
This second expansion comes in a book. You can now have cyber cows, cows coming from everywhere in the world. You can buy lasers, armors, etc.

There is also an RPG: Middle-Farm Role Playing Game, and a solo adventure...

Name: Familien-Bande
Description:
Who of you am I?
Who of us would like to be a Rock-Star?
Who uses the telephone for the longest time?

By mixing up your family you change into another role. Guess who I am and find out what I do.

A "family-game" where you learn more about others....

Name: Kalzure Zakuza
Description:
A game about war and futuristic mecha's fighting over land. The game consist of multiple land boards 1 1d4 die 3 1d6 dice and 1 20 sided die. And the mecha character sheets featuring unbelievable artillery such as rocket launchers hand rockets. Jet boots and more the objective is to destroy all opposing mecha enemies and take there land.

When all land is yours you win the game this game is played a lot like Risk and Gundam mixed together. It is a new idea and hopefully one that will make it to stores.

Name: Atilla vagy Aetius?
Description: Atilla vagy Aetius? ("Atilla or Aetius?") is a card-based strategy game that simulates the famous Battle of the Catalaunian Plains. The game is for two players, but it can also be played as a team game, so that two alliances can battle against each other.

Name: Christmas Party Gift Exchange Game
Description:
Game comes with two very large soft dice, a plastic gameboard, and an electronic timer.

This is a party game where everyone brings wrapped gifts of about the same value to the game. Then you roll dice, in this case very large soft "Zunker Dice" as they are called, in order to determine what happens to those gifts.

The game has two different stages.

In the first stage you roll the dice and depending on what number you roll (a 7,11,Doubles) you either select one of the wrapped gifts, unwrap it and keep it in front of you, (roll a 5) pass an unopened gift from the pile of gifts in the center to the player to your right, (roll a 9) pass a gift to the player to your left or (roll any other number) proceed to the next player.

In the second stage, after all gifts have been opened, you have another round of dice rolling during which get to find out what gifts you will keep. Rolls of 5 or 9 force you to give one of your opened gifts to the player on your right or left just like in stage 1. The roll of a 7,11 or double allows you to yell the word ZUNKER and then take a gift from anyone and place it in front of you. If you don't say ZUNKER you get to take nothing!  During this second stage you use the included timer which is set for 20 minutes. After the 20 minutes has expired the game is over and you keep whatever gift(s) that you have still in front of you.

Name: Battle of Adrianople (378 AD)
Description:
“The Roman Empire was feeling increasing pressure from the German tribes on its border. The German tribes were themselves suffering at the hands of the Huns. The Romans agreed to allow the Visigoths to move through Roman territory to escape the marauding Huns. Relations soon soured, however, and the Visigoths began raiding the villages in their path."

"Valens, the Eastern Emperor, led his army to fight the Visigoths and sent a request for help to the Western Emperor. When Valens reached Adrianople he decided to attack alone rather than waiting for the Western Army. It was a fatal mistake.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per base. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules. Units portrayed in the game include Infantry, Cavalry, Skirmishers, and Roman Generals.

Name: Against the Scourge of God
Description:
“The Huns were fearsome nomadic horsemen from the steppes of Central Europe. The Hunnic tribes routinely raided and pillaged their neighbors, and each other. The famed Attila was able to unite many of the tribes under his leadership. His devastating attacks on the Christian peoples of Europe earned Attila the nickname 'The Scourge of God.'"

"In 451 AD Attila led a large army west across the Rhine River. After rampaging through Gaul for a time the Huns were confronted by an army commanded by the Roman general Aetius and the Visigoth General Theodoric. At the battle of Chalons the Hunnic invasion was turned back. This decisive victory saved Western Europe from the Huns.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per base. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also available for use with the rules. Units portrayed in the game include Commanders, Cavalry (heavy and light), Infantry, and Archers.

Name: Battle of Hastings (1066 AD)
Description:
“When Edward the Confessor, King of England, died without an heir three men claimed the throne. Harold Godwinson had the advantage of actually being in England, and he was crowned king. The other claimants, William Duke of Normandy and Harald Hardrada (King of Norway), were prepared to fight for the throne."

"Hardrada struck first, invading Northern England with a large Viking army . . . The Vikings were routed, and Hardrada was killed. Harold didn't get much time to celebrate, however, as he was soon informed that William had landed in Southern England with an army of Norman knights and mercenaries.”

“Again Harold raced to meet the threat. He decided to confront the Normans as soon as possible. Harold's Saxons formed their shield wall on top of Senlac Hill. With their flanks protected by rough terrain, they knew the Normans would be forced to attempt a frontal assault. All day long the Normans tried and failed to break through the Saxon lines. Then Harold's men made a fatal error and chased the Normans back down the hill, opening gaps in their shield wall. The Normans were quick to exploit the mistake, and they were able to break through and win. Harold was killed on the field of battle, and William became King of England.”
 A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per base. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

The Saxon force is divided into five commands composed of Fyrd militia and Housecarls. The Norman force is also divided into five commands, each of which is composed of cavalry, infantry, and archers.

Name: Battle of Hattin (1187 AD)
Description:
A recreation of the Battle of Hattin.

“In 1170 AD a new, powerful leader rose to lead the Muslim counterattack. For a while Saladin, as he was known in the West, maintained an uneasy peace with the crusaders. However a series of provocations by the crusaders broke the truce and finally forced his hand."

"He gathered a large army and laid siege to Tiberias. The Crusaders went for the bait and marched to the rescue. Their line of march took them across a desert where the heavily armored knights suffered terribly in the summer heat. Saladin sent soldiers to harass them during the march, slowing their advance to a crawl."

"The army was dying of thirst when they approached Lake Tiberias only to find Saladin’s army blocking their path. In the battle that followed the crusader army was destroyed. Raymond of Tripoli was the only commander to escape, the other the crusader leaders were killed or captured. Saladin’s forces also capture a treasured holy relic – the ‘True Cross.’”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures or free print-and-play paper miniatures provided with the rules.

Name: Battle of Liegnitz (1241 AD)
Description:
“In 1241 the mighty Mongol army launched an invasion into Europe. While the main force headed for a showdown in Hungary a smaller army was sent into Poland as a diversion. A large Polish and Germany army, led by Henry the Pious of Silesia, marched off to link up with King Wenceslas of Bohemia's army. The Mongols confronted them as they passed the town of Liegnitz. Although outnumbered, the Mongols fought brilliantly and inflicted a devastating defeat on their opponents.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per stand. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules. Units portrayed in the game include commanders, mounted knights, crossbowmen, light cavalry, archers, and Teutonic infantry.

The game requires a table of approximately 7.5x5 feet. The only terrain features portrayed in the game are several hills which separate the opposing forces.

Name: Time's Up
Description: Children's educational game for learning to tell time. Adjust clock faces to match the 54 cards depicting various times. Four different player clock faces in a range of difficulties can be chosen from, depending on the ability of the children playing.
Families: Misc: Dice Tower Hall of Fame

Name: Siege of Kenilworth Castle (1266)
Description:
A classroom game for six groups of history students, grades 6 to 8.

“The Siege of Kenilworth Castle was the longest in English history. The attackers tried everything to take the castle using a variety of siege weapons, including Trebuchets and siege towers. Their attacks focused on the north wall, which was judged to be the weakest part of the defenses. The defenders used the lake to bring in supplies, so the attackers built rafts and barges to stop them. They also tried to attack the castle by crossing the lake on barges. Finally, after nine months, disease and hunger forced the garrison to surrender.”

“The simulation is a matrix game, and for the most part follows the standard matrix game rules . . . Divide the students into six groups and assign them one of the commanders in the order of battle. It's a good idea to include a good student on each team. The simulation can be played in one period (one hour or less).”

“The siege will end when the attackers can capture the Norman Keep, the defenders can successfully argue that the siege is lifted or abandoned, or one side successfully argues for a peace settlement."

Name: In the Year of One Reed
Description:
A classroom game for four groups of history students, grades 6 to 8. The game requires a print-and-play mapsheet, a standard deck of playing cards, and a six-sided die.

“Historical Background (1519 - 1521): In the great Aztec city of Tenochtitlan Emperor Montezuma had reason to worry. It was the year of One Reed, when the feathered serpent Quetzalcoatl would return to bring an end to Aztec civilization. A comet had been seen in the sky, a very bad omen."

"Messengers arrived to tell Montezuma that powerful strangers had arrived at the coast. The strangers were Spaniards under the command of Hernan Cortes. Montezuma was paralyzed by indecision. Should he fight the newcomers or welcome them?"

"He would soon learn that the Spanish conquistadors were on a mission to conquer and loot the Aztec empire. They brought with them horses, powerful weapons, and deadly germs. Many of the local tribes saw the invaders as a chance to defeat their Aztec overlords and joined their army. Cortes and his men would destroy Tenochtitlan and the Aztec empire.”

The game ends once Cortes (controlled by the teacher) has conquered the Aztecs by destroying their armies or occupying their capital. Sample questions for classroom discussion are included.

Name: Anaconda (1864)
Description:
“United States, 1864.  The civil war that both sides had expected to end swiftly has dragged into its third year.  The Union blockade of the South, the Anaconda Plan developed by General Winfield Scott and established in 1861, has finally started to take its toll on the Confederate military and its civilian population.  Southern logisticians estimate that with current supplies, the South will be forced to surrender due to inability to maintain its military and severe economic hardships in five months.”
 “Objective:  Be the first side to drive their opponent to the breaking point through a careful combination of naval strategy and army operations - force the surrender of the Confederacy by exhausting their war stocks (zero weeks remaining), or inflict an unacceptable additional 100,000 casualties on the Union (700,000 total), forcing the North to sue for peace.”

“Players of the same side sit side by side on one side of a table (or the floor), facing their opponents.  Each player along the line plays a regional military commander with one army regiment and one navy squadron assigned to his control.  Players can assume the identities of historic Union and Confederate generals and admirals, or simply be referred to as Commander 1, Commander 2, etc. down the lines."

"This opposing line of players stretches from Virginia down the southern Atlantic and Gulf Coast to Texas and then up the Mississippi River Valley.  Any map of the eastern United States can be used, or an outline of the coast created with masking tape, but is not required for play.  Each commander has six cards; two navy, two army and two special cards.”

“In multi-player games, players can only communicate by passing messages verbally to other commanders seated immediately beside them . . . Washington and Richmond can attempt to pass a grand strategy to the rest of the team at the beginning of a turn, but the word must be passed ‘down the line.’”

Name: WW I Aerial Combat (1914-1918 AD)
Description:
“It was during World War I that the airplane became an important weapon of war. At the start of the war the planes were unarmed and were used for scouting. Soon the pilots were taking weapons with them on their flights. These early efforts were crude, but Dutch inventor Anthony Fokker eventually succeeded in synchronizing a machine gun with an engine so the weapon could fire through the propeller. This led to the ‘Fokker scourge’ as the Germans used the new invention to dominate the skies. The Allies soon followed suit and battled the Germans for control of the skies over no man's land. Successful ‘aces’, like the Red Baron, were lionized by the press and became living legends. By the end of the war the airplane's role in combat had expanded to include reconnaissance, artillery spotting, trench strafing, and bombing.”

A simple historical miniatures air combat game designed for classroom use in grades 6-8. The game may be played by eight players using 1/72 scale models on a Battle Masters mat (4x4 feet with five inch hexes).

Each player uses an aircraft model (Allied or German) on a stand, a deck of maneuver cards, a laminated record card (for tracking damage and victories with a dry erase marker), and 5 six-sided dice. Each record card includes the name and picture of a World War One ace, his victory total, and brief biographical information.

Name: Zeppelins Over London: WW I Airships (1916 AD)
Description:
“It is now spring of 1916.  Improvements in anti-aircraft artillery and airplane performance have begun to threaten the zeppelins’ invulnerability. While British arms manufacturers are busy developing incendiary and explosive ammunition (which would seal the fate of the flammable hydrogen filled zeppelins), the ammunition will not be widely available until the summer. The RAF 39 Squadron, flying the Bristol B.E.2c fighter and established to defend London from zeppelin raids, has just received word that a large formation of zeppelins is approaching the city!”

A simple historical miniatures air combat game designed for classroom use. The game is played by two teams representing the British and German forces. The British players have twenty Bristol fighters divided into five divisions and the German players have twelve airships divided into three divisions. The British players attempt to shoot down as many zeppelins as possible before the airships can move off the end of the board or time runs out.

Designed to be played using models, or print-and-play paper aircraft, on a 7.5x5 foot hex mat with three inch hexes.

Name: The Few: Battle of Britain
Description:
A classroom game based on the Battle of Britain. Combat is resolved by drawing cards from a standard card deck. Other components required for play are German and British Flight Rosters, a Battle Board, the Reinforcements schedule, and the Combat Resolution Tables.

“Divide the class into two groups - the RAF (Britain) and Luftwaffe (Germany). Each team must have an air marshal. Air marshals will be in charge of allocating resources and aircraft to targets, and filling in the flight roster. The remaining students will be pilots (German fighter or bomber pilots, British fighter pilots). If necessary, divide the students in small groups and call them ‘wings.’ The German players start with 10 bombers and 10 fighters. The British players start with 6 fighters. This information should be put on the flight rosters.”

“The Battle Board should be drawn on the chalkboard, or someplace else where all the students can see it. On the Battle Board write the three targets: air bases, radar, and London. This is where each turn you will write down the number and type of planes sent by each side to attack or defend each target.”

“Objective: Germany must either destroy London OR both the air bases AND radar. The British win by destroying 15 German planes or preventing the Germans from winning. The battle will last 5 turns or until one side wins a victory.”
Families: History: World War II (Battle of Britain)
